text: id: prog_btech_ai | name: B.Tech in Artificial Intelligence | duration: 4 years | degree: B.Tech | description: Undergraduate engineering program focusing on machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, and NLP with industry projects. | eligibility_summary: 10+2 with PCM, minimum 60% aggregate or JEE Main score as per institute cutoff | official_document: syllabus_btech_ai_2025.pdf | last_updated: 2025-08-01

id: prog_bdes | name: B.Design (Industrial Design) | duration: 4 years | degree: B.Des | description: Design program focused on product design, user experience, and prototyping. Portfolio required for admission. | eligibility_summary: 10+2 in any stream; portfolio required; design entrance test. | official_document: bdes_portfolio_guidelines.pdf | last_updated: 2025-07-10

id: prog_mba | name: MBA (Business Analytics) | duration: 2 years | degree: MBA | description: Postgraduate program combining business fundamentals with data analytics, statistical modeling, and practical industry projects. | eligibility_summary: Bachelor's degree with minimum 50%; CAT / MAT / XAT / Institute entrance test. | official_document: mba_business_analytics_brochure.pdf | last_updated: 2025-09-12

id: prog_ba_journalism | name: BA in Media & Journalism | duration: 3 years | degree: BA | description: Covers reporting, multimedia journalism, ethics, and media law with hands-on studio practice. | eligibility_summary: 10+2 in any stream; personal interview for shortlisted candidates. | official_document: ba_media_curriculum.pdf | last_updated: 2025-06-15

id: prog_mtech_cs | name: M.Tech in Computer Science | duration: 2 years | degree: M.Tech | description: Advanced program with research and elective tracks in distributed systems, ML, and cybersecurity. | eligibility_summary: B.Tech or equivalent in relevant discipline; GATE preferred. | official_document: mtech_cs_outline.pdf | last_updated: 2025-05-20

id: prog_bcom | name: B.Com (Honours) | duration: 3 years | degree: B.Com | description: Commerce program with specialization options in finance, accounting, and taxation. | eligibility_summary: 10+2 in commerce or equivalent with minimum 50%. | official_document: bcom_hons_structure.pdf | last_updated: 2025-04-10

id: course_ai_ml | program_id: prog_btech_ai | code: AI301 | title: Machine Learning | semester: 5 | credits: 4 | short_description: Supervised and unsupervised learning, evaluation metrics, model selection, and practical labs.
id: course_ai_dl | program_id: prog_btech_ai | code: AI401 | title: Deep Learning | semester: 7 | credits: 4 | short_description: Neural networks, CNNs, RNNs, transformers, and project work.

id: course_design_ideation | program_id: prog_bdes | code: DES101 | title: Design Thinking & Ideation | semester: 1 | credits: 3 | short_description: Human-centered design, prototyping methods, case studies.

id: course_stats | program_id: prog_mba | code: BA201 | title: Business Statistics | semester: 1 | credits: 3 | short_description: Descriptive statistics, probability distributions, hypothesis testing.

id: course_journalism_reporting | program_id: prog_ba_journalism | code: MJ102 | title: News Reporting & Writing | semester: 1 | credits: 3 | short_description: Basics of news gathering, ethics, and writing for print and digital.

id: course_cs_security | program_id: prog_mtech_cs | code: CS501 | title: Advanced Cybersecurity | semester: 3 | credits: 4 | short_description: Network security, crypto primitives, secure systems design.
id: course_fin_acct | program_id: prog_bcom | code: BC201 | title: Financial Accounting | semester: 2 | credits: 3 | short_description: Accounting principles, ledgers, and financial statements.
id: course_ai_project | program_id: prog_btech_ai | code: AI499 | title: Capstone Project | semester: 8 | credits: 8 | short_description: Industry-linked or research capstone project.

id: course_design_prototyping | program_id: prog_bdes | code: DES301 | title: Prototyping & Materials | semester: 5 | credits: 3 | short_description: Physical prototyping, material selection, CAD basics.
id: course_mba_case | program_id: prog_mba | code: BA402 | title: Case Methods in Analytics | semester: 4 | credits: 3 | short_description: Business case analysis using quantitative tools.

id: course_journalism_media_law | program_id: prog_ba_journalism | code: MJ204 | title: Media Law and Ethics | semester: 3 | credits: 3 | short_description: Media regulation, defamation, privacy and ethical reporting.

id: course_cs_research_methods | program_id: prog_mtech_cs | code: CS601 | title: Research Methods | semester: 1 | credits: 2 | short_description: Research design, literature review, and scientific writing.

id: adm_undergrad_general | type: Undergraduate | application_steps: Fill online application form, Upload 10+2 mark sheet and photo ID, Pay application fee, Appear for design/entrance if applicable, Attend interview (if shortlisted) | application_fee: ₹1200 | important_dates: applications_open=2025-01-15, applications_close=2025-06-30, merit_list=2025-07-15

id: adm_postgrad_general | type: Postgraduate | application_steps: Fill online application, Upload degree certificate and transcripts, Submit entrance test scores (if available), Interview for final selection | application_fee: ₹1500 | important_dates: applications_open=2025-02-01, applications_close=2025-07-31, interviews_start=2025-08-10
id: adm_scholarship_docs | type: Scholarship | required_documents: Income certificate, Previous year grade transcript, Scholarship application form
id: adm_portfolio | type: Portfolio | notes: B.Design applicants must upload a 10-page PDF portfolio; accepted formats: PDF; max size 10MB.
id: adm_hostel | type: Hostel Allotment | process: Apply online for hostel within 7 days of admission, Pay hostel deposit, Submit medical form
id: adm_transfer | type: Lateral Entry / Transfer | notes: Subject to availability and eligibility; requires transcripts and NOC from previous institute.
id: fee_btech_ai_year | program_id: prog_btech_ai | amount_per_year: ₹180000 | payment_schedule: Yearly | refund_policy: Full refund within 7 days; after 30 days no refund
id: fee_bdes_year | program_id: prog_bdes | amount_per_year: ₹150000 | payment_schedule: Yearly | refund_policy: Full refund within 10 days; prorated refund within first 30 days
id: fee_mba_year | program_id: prog_mba | amount_per_year: ₹220000 | payment_schedule: Semester | refund_policy: Subject to institute rules
id: fee_hostel_single | type: Hostel - Single | amount_per_year: ₹60000 | notes: Includes basic mess facilities
id: fee_hostel_shared | type: Hostel - Shared | amount_per_year: ₹42000 | notes: Shared room with three students
id: fee_processing | type: Application Processing Fee | amount: ₹1200 | notes: Non-refundable

id: scholar_merit_top10 | name: Merit Scholarship - Top 10 | eligibility: Top 10 rank holders in entrance/merit list | benefit: 50% tuition waiver | application_required: False | last_updated: 2025-03-01

id: scholar_sports | name: Sports Scholarship | eligibility: State or national level representation | benefit: 25-40% tuition waiver depending on level | application_required: Submission of certificates

id: scholar_need_based | name: Need-based Assistance | eligibility: Household income below ₹3,00,000 per annum | benefit: Up to 75% tuition support subject to verification | application_required: True
id: scholar_female_stem | name: Women in STEM Scholarship | eligibility: Female students enrolling in engineering or CS programs | benefit: 20% tuition waiver | application_required: True

id: faq_admission_deadline | question: When do applications for undergraduate programs close? | answer: For 2025, undergraduate applications close on June 30, 2025. Always confirm the dates on the admissions page as they may change.

id: faq_portfolio_requirement | question: Do I need a portfolio for B.Design? | answer: Yes. B.Design applicants must submit a 10-page PDF portfolio demonstrating design projects, sketches, and process work.

id: faq_refund_policy | question: What is the fee refund policy? | answer: Full refund if withdrawn within 7-10 days (program dependent). After 30 days, refunds are typically not provided. Check the program fee page for exact timelines.
id: faq_hostel_apply | question: How do I apply for hostel accommodation? | answer: Apply within 7 days of admission via the student portal and pay the hostel deposit to confirm your seat.

id: faq_placement_stats | question: What are the placement statistics? | answer: Placement stats vary by program; the latest placement report is published annually. Example: Computer Science average package (2024): ₹7.2 LPA.

id: faq_internship_support | question: Does the college help with internships? | answer: Yes. The placement cell maintains internship listings and assists students with applications and resume review.

id: faq_medical_emergency | question: What to do in a medical emergency on campus? | answer: Contact campus medical center at +91-79-XXXXXXX or visit the medical clinic located near the north gate. Emergency ambulance services are available.
id: faq_contact_admissions | question: How can I contact admissions? | answer: Email admissions@example.edu or call +91-79-YYYYYYYY during office hours (Mon-Fri 9:30am-5:30pm).

id: faq_exam_policy | question: What is the exam re-evaluation procedure? | answer: Students can apply for re-evaluation within 10 days of results announcement by submitting the form and paying the fee.
id: faq_scholarship_apply | question: How to apply for scholarships? | answer: Most scholarships require an online application, supporting documents, and income proof where applicable.

id: place_recruiters | top_recruiters: Tata Consultancy Services, Infosys, Accenture, Flipkart, Cognizant | average_package_cs_2024: ₹7.2 LPA | highest_package_2024: ₹18 LPA | placement_cell_contact: placements@example.edu
id: place_internship_guidelines | guidelines: Students must register internships through the placement portal. Internship credits are awarded after supervisor evaluation.

id: event_techfest_2025 | title: TechFest 2025 | date: 2025-10-12 | description: Annual technical festival with hackathons, workshops, and guest talks.
id: event_design_showcase | title: Design Showcase | date: 2025-11-20 | description: Student design exhibition highlighting final-year projects.
id: event_internship_fair | title: Internship Fair | date: 2025-09-15 | description: Companies and startups present internship opportunities to students.
id: event_placement_workshop | title: Resume & Interview Workshop | date: 2025-08-25 | description: Hands-on workshop run by placement cell and industry mentors.
id: policy_attendance | title: Attendance Policy | summary: Students must maintain minimum 75% attendance to be eligible for end semester exams. Medical exemptions require documentation.
id: policy_academic_integrity | title: Academic Integrity Policy | summary: Plagiarism and cheating are punishable; re-exams or disciplinary actions may be taken.
id: policy_refund | title: Fee Refund Policy | summary: Full refund within 7-10 days depending on program; partial refunds limited within first 30 days.

id: annc_exam_schedule_sem2 | title: Semester 2 Exam Schedule Released | date: 2025-10-01 | content: Semester 2 exam schedule is available on the student portal. Check your department page for venue and timing.
id: annc_hostel_vacancy | title: Hostel Vacancies for Spring | date: 2025-09-20 | content: Limited hostel seats available for Spring semester. Apply via the hostel portal by Sep 30, 2025.
id: annc_internship_fair_reminder | title: Internship Fair Reminder | date: 2025-09-10 | content: Internship Fair on Sep 15. Register on the placement portal by Sep 13, 2025.

id: q1 | question: What programs do you offer in engineering? | answer: We offer B.Tech programs including B.Tech in Artificial Intelligence and M.Tech in Computer Science. See the programs list for details.

id: q2 | question: What is the eligibility for B.Tech in Artificial Intelligence? | answer: Eligibility: 10+2 with Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics with a minimum 60% aggregate or a qualifying JEE Main score as per institute cutoff.
id: q3 | question: Do B.Design applicants need a portfolio? | answer: Yes. B.Design applicants must submit a 10-page PDF portfolio demonstrating design projects and sketches. Maximum size 10MB.
id: q4 | question: When do undergraduate applications close? | answer: Undergraduate applications close on June 30, 2025 for the 2025 intake.
id: q5 | question: How do I apply for hostel accommodation? | answer: Apply within 7 days of admission via the student portal and pay the hostel deposit to confirm your seat.
id: q6 | question: What is the tuition fee for B.Tech AI? | answer: The tuition fee for B.Tech in Artificial Intelligence is ₹1,80,000 per year.
id: q7 | question: Are scholarships available for merit students? | answer: Yes. Merit Scholarship - Top 10 offers a 50% tuition waiver for top 10 rank holders.
id: q8 | question: How do I contact the placement cell? | answer: Email placements@example.edu or visit the Placement Cell in Room 210, Admin Block.
id: q9 | question: What are the hostel types and costs? | answer: Hostel Block A is single occupancy at ₹60,000/year; Block B is shared (3 per room) at ₹42,000/year.
id: q10 | question: Who teaches Machine Learning? | answer: Dr. Meera Sharma, Associate Professor in Computer Science, specializes in Machine Learning and NLP.
id: q11 | question: What is the refund policy? | answer: Full refund if withdrawn within 7-10 days depending on the program; after 30 days refunds are typically not provided.
id: q12 | question: When is TechFest 2025? | answer: TechFest 2025 is scheduled for October 12, 2025.
id: q13 | question: How do I apply for scholarships? | answer: Most scholarships require an online application with supporting documents such as income proof and transcripts.
id: q14 | question: Does the college help with internships? | answer: Yes. The placement cell maintains internship listings and assists students with applications and resume review.
id: q15 | question: What is the average package for CS in 2024? | answer: Example: Computer Science average package (2024): ₹7.2 LPA.
id: q16 | question: How many credits is the Capstone Project? | answer: The Capstone Project (AI499) is 8 credits and typically taken in semester 8.

id: q17 | question: What documents are required for admissions? | answer: Common documents: 10+2 marksheet, photo ID, passport-size photograph, transfer certificate (if applicable). See admissions page for full list.
id: q18 | question: What are office hours for the admissions office? | answer: Admissions office hours are Monday to Friday 9:30am to 5:30pm.
id: q19 | question: How to request a re-evaluation of exam results? | answer: Apply for re-evaluation within 10 days of results announcement by submitting the form and paying the fee.
id: q20 | question: Is there a medical center on campus? | answer: Yes. Campus Medical Center is available 24x7. Contact +91-79-88889999.
id: q21 | question: What is the attendance requirement? | answer: Students must maintain minimum 75% attendance to be eligible for end semester exams; medical exemptions require documentation.
id: q22 | question: When are placement activities conducted? | answer: Pre-placement talks occur Aug-Sep, application window Sep-Oct, and final placements typically Nov-Dec.
id: q23 | question: Who should I contact for IT help? | answer: Contact IT Helpdesk at ithelp@example.edu or phone +91-79-33332222 during office hours.
id: q24 | question: Can I transfer credits from another university? | answer: Lateral entry or transfers are subject to availability and require transcripts and an NOC from the previous institute.
id: q25 | question: What is the policy on plagiarism? | answer: Plagiarism and cheating are punishable under the Academic Integrity Policy; penalties may include re-exams or disciplinary action.
id: q26 | question: Are there clubs and societies? | answer: Yes. The university has multiple clubs: coding club, design society, media club, entrepreneurship cell, and more.
id: q27 | question: How to find library timings? | answer: Library timings are Monday-Saturday 9:00am to 8:00pm. Contact library@example.edu for more details.
id: q28 | question: What is the application fee? | answer: The application processing fee is ₹1,200 and is non-refundable.
id: q29 | question: How to register for the Internship Fair? | answer: Register via the placement portal by the date specified in the internship fair announcement.
id: q30 | question: Do you provide placement handbooks? | answer: Yes. Placement resources and handbooks are available; see placement_resources_handbook.pdf.
id: q31 | question: How to check my exam venue? | answer: Exam venue details are posted on the student portal and department notice boards; check the Semester 2 exam schedule announcement.
id: q32 | question: What is the Women in STEM scholarship? | answer: Women in STEM Scholarship offers a 20% tuition waiver for eligible female students enrolling in engineering or CS programs.
id: q33 | question: Are there industry projects in curriculum? | answer: Yes. Programs like B.Tech AI include industry-linked projects and a capstone project in the final year.
id: q34 | question: How to contact hostel warden? | answer: Hostel wardens: Block A +91-79-AAAABBBB; Block B +91-79-CCCCDDDD.
id: q35 | question: What is the maximum portfolio size for B.Design? | answer: Maximum portfolio size is 10MB; submit as a 10-page PDF.
id: q36 | question: Where is the placement office located? | answer: Placement Cell is located in Room 210, Admin Block.
id: q37 | question: What is the highest package in 2024? | answer: The highest package recorded in 2024 was ₹18 LPA.
id: q38 | question: How are internship credits evaluated? | answer: Internship credits are awarded after supervisor evaluation and submission of a final report.
id: q39 | question: Can I defer admission? | answer: Admission deferral is considered on a case-by-case basis and requires formal application to the admissions office.
id: q40 | question: Who handles placements for B.Des students? | answer: Placement cell handles placements for all programs; design-specific recruiters are coordinated with the Design department.
